snippet: Breaking up by virtually disappearing is becoming an increasingly popular, if frustrating, way to ditch a relationship.
abstract: Ghosting, a confounding trend in dating in which one partner abruptly ends a relationship and ignores all attempts at communication, is increasingly common; experts say such behavior is not new, but is made more powerful and painful when apps like Tinder and Grindr allow the abandoned party to see that life has gone on happily without them.
lead_paragraph: Breaking up by virtually disappearing is becoming an increasingly popular, if frustrating, way to ditch a relationship.

headline.main: Exes Explain Ghosting, the Ultimate Silent Treatment
headline.print_headline: When a Relationship Turns, Silence Says Everything
